item.title: The Measure of a Man and a Ministry | 2 Corinthians 10:12-18
item.itunes:title: The Measure of a Man and a Ministry | 2 Corinthians 10:12-18
item.description:
In this expositional sermon, Pastor Brandon Scroggins of Reformation Baptist Church unpacks the Apostle Paul‚Äôs teaching in 2 Corinthians 10:12‚Äì18, addressing the danger of self-commendation, comparison, and the true measure of a faithful ministry. Drawing from Old and New Testament examples‚Äîfrom Gideon to King Herod, from Corinth to modern culture‚Äîthis message confronts our temptation to boast in ourselves rather than in the Lord.

We live in an age dominated by social media boasting, insecurity masked by pride, and spiritual one-upmanship. But Paul gives us a different metric: faithfulness, humility, God-given authority, and Christ-exalting boasting.

üîç Whether you're a church leader, a parent, or a young believer wrestling with comparison, this sermon offers rich, biblical clarity and deep encouragement.

¬†

Sermon Text: 2 Corinthians 10:12-18 1. We don‚Äôt measure ourselves by those who commend themselves (2 Cor 10:12) 2. We don‚Äôt boast beyond the limits that God has allotted to us (2 Cor 10:13-14) 3. We don‚Äôt take credit for the work that others have done (2 Cor 10:15-16) 4. We boast in the Lord and live for His approval (2 Cor 10:17-18) ¬† Recorded Sunday, January 25th of 2026

item.title: New Mercies for a New Year | The DNA & Direction of Reformation Baptist Church
item.itunes:title: New Mercies for a New Year | The DNA & Direction of Reformation Baptist Church
item.description:
As we enter a new year, Pastor Brandon Scroggins calls us to step back and ask a foundational question: Where are we going‚Äîand why? In this sermon, we examine the biblical DNA, covenantal commitments, and mission of Reformation Baptist Church.

Drawing from Scripture, church history, and the powerful example of King Alfred the Great, this message lays out the aim, trajectory, and calling of the Christian life‚Äîboth individually and corporately. This is a call to intentional living, covenant faithfulness, sacrificial love, and joyful obedience under the lordship of Christ.

This sermon unpacks:

  • The purpose of the local church

  • Why covenant membership matters

  • How Christians are called to love Christ supremely

  • What it means to care for one another as a covenant family

  • Why every believer is saved to serve

  • The centrality of family worship and discipleship

  • The mission of gospel witness to the nations

  • Walking faithfully in a decaying culture

  • Trusting God‚Äôs sovereignty as we march forward together

‚ÄúWe are not saved to sit. We are saved to serve.‚Äù May God grant us grace to be faithful with the one life He has given us‚Äîfor His glory and our good.

item.title: The DNA & Direction of RBC: New Mercies and New Opportunities | Pastor Brandon Scroggins
item.itunes:title: The DNA & Direction of RBC: New Mercies and New Opportunities | Pastor Brandon Scroggins
item.description:
Join us for this special post-Christmas sermon where Pastor Brandon Scroggins steps away from our regular exposition in 2 Corinthians to refocus our hearts on the mission and convictions of Reformation Baptist Church. Each year, the first sermon after Christmas is a time to renew our covenant commitments, evaluate our trajectory, and remind ourselves why we exist as a local body of believers.

Pastor Brandon walks through our church covenant, revisits the resolutions of Jonathan Edwards, and casts a vision for 2026 rooted in Scripture, prayer, holiness, and joyful, gospel-centered mission. If you're a member, new attender, or just exploring what Reformation Baptist Church is all about‚Äîthis is the sermon to hear.

Third, trust in God for the future‚Äîafter entering the Promised Land, the manna ceased, and they had to rely on God‚Äôs new means of provision. ‚Ä¢ You have shown us Your Favor (v. 1)

item.title: The Man of God
item.itunes:title: The Man of God
item.description:
Sermon Text: Psalm 112
Sermon Outline:
1. The Fear of the Man of God (Psalm 112:1)
Psalm 112:1 Praise the Lord! Blessed is the man who fears the Lord, who greatly delights in his commandments!
2. The Children of the Man of God (Psalm 112:2)
Psalm 112:2 His offspring will be mighty in the land; the generation of the upright will be blessed.
3. The Wealth of the Man of God (Psalm 112:3)
Psalm 112:3 Wealth and riches are in his house, and his righteousness endures forever.
4. The Character of the Man of God (Psalm 112:4-5)
Psalm 112:4 Light dawns in the darkness for the upright; he is gracious, merciful, and righteous. 5 It is well with the man who deals generously and lends; who conducts his affairs with justice.
5. The Confidence of the Man of God (Psalm 112:6-8)
Psalm 112:6 For the righteous will never be moved; he will be remembered forever. 7 He is not afraid of bad news; his heart is firm, trusting in the Lord. 8 His heart is steady; he will not be afraid, until he looks in triumph on his adversaries.
6. The Honor of the Man of God (Psalm 112:9)
Psalm 112:9 He has distributed freely; he has given to the poor; his righteousness endures forever; his horn is exalted in honor.
7. The Enemies of the Man of God (Psalm 112:10)
Psalm 112:10 The wicked man sees it and is angry; he gnashes his teeth and melts away; the desire of the wicked will perish! ¬† Recorded Sunday, June 16th of 2024

item.title: 2 Options, 2 Men, 2 Resurrections
item.itunes:title: 2 Options, 2 Men, 2 Resurrections
item.description:
Sermon Text: 1 Corinthians 15:20-22
Sermon Outline:
1.) Eternal Hope: Death and Resurrection (1 Cor 15:20)
2.) Federal Headship: Adam and Christ (1 Cor 15:21-22)
See chapter 6 of the 1689 London Baptist Confession
1) The resurrection rooted Gospel faith in historical facts.
2) The resurrection validated that Jesus is who He claimed to be: truly God and truly man.
3) The resurrection displayed the sovereign authority of Jesus and the supremacy of the Godhead.
4) The resurrection demonstrated that Jesus finished what He came to do: defeat death, sin, and Satan.
5) The resurrection confirmed God‚Äôs acceptance of Jesus‚Äô sacrifice for the sins of His people.
6) The resurrection proclaimed the exclusivity of the gospel, that there is eternal life in none other.
7) The resurrection prepared for those who trust in Christ to be raised to life as Christ Himself.
The resurrection enabled believers to live a resurrected life.
9) The resurrection provided for Jesus Christ to intercede for believers to live a resurrected life.
10) The resurrection foreshadowed the new life that God will bring in regenerating the entire cosmos. ¬† Recorded Sunday, March 31st of 2024
